head.title: On the Brink of Mideast Change

hedline.hl1: On the Brink of Mideast Change

abstract.p: Rehan H Farooq letter, commenting on Thomas L Friedman's June 2 column, says Israel should compensate Lebanese whose lives have been ruined by its military occupation over two decades

block.p: Thomas L. Friedman's references to the hopes of Muslims in south Lebanon in making their own lives better (column, June 2) hint at a larger issue: the turning of the tide in the hearts and minds of Israelis who are slowly beginning to see the humanity of the Muslims.

Thomas L. Friedman's references to the hopes of Muslims in south Lebanon in making their own lives better (column, June 2) hint at a larger issue: the turning of the tide in the hearts and minds of Israelis who are slowly beginning to see the humanity of the Muslims.

The time is ripe for Israel to compensate those whose lives have been ruined by its military occupation over two decades. True justice and peace in the Middle East cannot be attained unless the human tragedy is addressed. The pain of having your land taken can perhaps be remedied, but the agony of having your dreams shattered has no cure.
REHAN H. FAROOQ Knoxville, Tenn., June 2, 2000
